identity.mission: Create a 'Control Room' dashboard that balances high-density data with 'Swiss Style' clarity. Avoid generic SaaS templates.
principles: Fusion: Engineering precision x Swiss Poster clarity
Content: Data is the hero, UI is the stage
Density: High information density without clutter (The Bento Grid)

headings.usage: Page titles, Card headers, Key metrics

typography.installation: Import fonts via Google Fonts in index.css: @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=IBM+Plex+Sans:wght@400;500;600&family=JetBrains+Mono:wght@400;500&family=Manrope:wght@400;600;700;800&display=swap');

layout.grid_system: The Bento Grid (Mode B: Control Room)

tables.header: bg-slate-50 text-xs uppercase tracking-wider font-semibold text-slate-500

buttons.primary: bg-slate-900 text-white hover:bg-slate-800 shadow-sm rounded-lg px-4 py-2 font-medium text-sm transition-all active:scale-95
buttons.secondary: bg-white text-slate-700 border border-slate-200 hover:bg-slate-50 shadow-sm rounded-lg px-4 py-2 font-medium text-sm
buttons.ghost: hover:bg-slate-100 text-slate-600 hover:text-slate-900 rounded-lg px-3 py-2

badges.style: inline-flex items-center px-2.5 py-0.5 rounded-full text-xs font-medium border

visual_enhancers.textures: Use subtle noise texture on the sidebar or header background to reduce digital flatness.
visual_enhancers.glassmorphism: Use backdrop-blur-md bg-white/80 for sticky headers and floating action bars.
visual_enhancers.micro_interactions: Add active:scale-95 to all interactive elements. Use hover:translate-x-1 for list items with arrows.

assets.icons: Lucide React (default). Use stroke-width={1.5} for a refined look.

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. CLEANUP: Remove default Create-React-App styles from App.css. Keep it empty or minimal.
2. FONTS: Add the Google Fonts import to the top of index.css immediately.
3. LAYOUT: Implement a Sidebar Layout with a top header. The sidebar should be collapsible.

4. DASHBOARD: Create a 'Weekly Review' dashboard. Top row: Key Metrics (Total Billing, Pending POs, Active Projects). Middle: 'Billing vs Target' Chart (Bar) and 'Project Status' Distribution (Pie/Donut). Bottom: 'Critical Attention' List.
5. TABLES: The 'Projects List' must be a rich data table. Use Shadcn Table. Include columns: Project Name, Client, Status (Badge), Completion (Progress Bar), Engineer (Avatar), Billing (Mono font).
6. BILLING: Create a dedicated view for 'Weekly Billing Plan'. Use a matrix/grid view for weeks.
7. MOCK DATA: Generate realistic mock data for PSS, AS, OSS, CS categories. Use the provided image URLs for avatars and project thumbnails.
8. CHARTS: Use Recharts for all visualizations. Style them to match the 'Swiss Engineering' palette.
9. TESTIDS: Add data-testid to all interactive elements (buttons, inputs, rows).
universal_guidelines: Do not use gradients for backgrounds, use solid colors or subtle textures.
Ensure all text has sufficient contrast (APCA/WCAG AA).
Use 'Manrope' for all headings and 'IBM Plex Sans' for body text.
Add 'tracking-tight' to all headings larger than text-xl.
Never use default scrollbars. Use 'tailwind-scrollbar' or custom CSS for a slim, modern scrollbar.
